title: For all practical purposes. Social choice. 3
brief_description: A Problem of fair division This video deals with fair division problems, using the example of sharing a cake between seven people and through various proportional representation electoral systems. There is an impossibility theorem that states that there is no perfect method of apportionment. Weighted voting systems do not solve the problem, which leads to a discussion of who has power in government. The Banzhof power index is demonstrated.
